つぐのひシリーズには興味がありましたが、わりと良い値段がするので半額だったこれをプレイしてみました
結論から言えばなかなか良くできた短編ホラーでした
ただ左に進むだけのゲームながら背景や通行人の変化や異常により『日常が侵食される』雰囲気が出ています
その『さり気なさ』から見ると、
一部、恐怖ポイントを強調するかのような注目演出があったのはむしろ雰囲気を崩している気がしました
若干ネタバレになりますが、
私がこのゲームで一番ゾッとしたのは「何気なくすれ違ったモブ」のある変化に気付いた瞬間だったので、
特にそう感じたのかもしれません

私はうっかり最初に裏エンドに辿り着いてしまっただめズッコケたのですが
改めてちゃんとホラーなエンドに辿り着いてみるとちゃんとホラーだったのでオススメです
明確な難点は値段
半額セール中だったのでオススメにしましたが、
ボリュームを考えると定価購入は割高に感じます

And to be frank, this isn't really a good Tsugunohi game. The man problem is that the game doesn't understand the subtle horror elements of the series. That being said I like the art and I think if I actually knew who Korone was I might enjoyed it as a parody but since I went in wanted a good horror game I'm gonna have to say skip this one it's really not worth it. 103670784.review:
Serious review here. In brief, if you are a fan of Inugami Korone, this game is for you. If you are unfamiliar with Korone and / or hololive, you will probably be confused and bored.

Evil God Korone is not so much a game as an interactive animated storybook with lore-building around our favorite doggo Vtuber. While it is technically a horror game, it's not at all scary, and indeed I was generally smiling and laughing throughout my two playthroughs. (You must play twice to see both endings.)

No skill is required; simply walk forward with the left arrow key, and advance dialogue with the left mouse button. That's it.

For Korone fans, there are plenty of Easter eggs, in-jokes, and other delights.

You can see the entire game's content in the many YouTube videos of hololive talents playing it, so why buy Evil God Korone? In spite of having already watched several gameplay streams, I wanted to experience it for myself, and I *did* enjoy it. More importantly, I wanted to support ImCyan for this fantastic piece of officially-sanctioned fan-art, and I hope to show Cover Corp. that there is fan demand for hololive video games. HoloEarth is at least a year away; but I think I speak for many fans when I say we *REALLY* want an ArcSys-style fighting game featuring the entire holo lineup!

The Philosophical implications of this games detailed, and invigorating story writing will be felt for generations to come. I've spent over 300 hours contemplating the pure prose that has been inscribed on the title screen - "Offer Yubi" what does that really mean? I remain hopeful that my dedicated studies to this game and the message behind it will finally offer me one thing; an end to the voices. I hope that if I remain stalwart and studious in my journey to mental awakening I can finally crack the universal code, and realize my goals of having Korone clean my kitchen and make me a red velvet cake with extra cream cheese frosting right next to my wife Tsumugi Kotobuki.

To my friends reading this I offer you one final piece of advice, if you have over 320 hours the game will unlock a hidden H-Vault offering a wealth of professionally done and voice acted visual stimuli for your monkey neurons. It must be said though, that this is not for the faint of heart. Trust Me...

102565636.review:
I am going to say: I enjoyed this game as a fan of Hololive, but please understand that this game is really a novelty at best for diehard fans of Korone (such as myself)! 

Tsuginohi is a series of Flash games that are basically horror scenes. Your nameless character walks through a path, and each trip through it gets more deranged and spookier. In the case of Evil God Korone, Korone manifests her will over the world. 

The game is short, but it is inoffensive for the pricetag it has. Any higher and I'd probably demand a refund. Now, I want to stress: this game is pretty well put together, presentation wise. It's a treat for Korone fans, and if you have an eagle eye you'll spot all sorts of fun details. 

The game is short, one run is about 20 minutes or so. There's only two routes- the default 'bad' ending, and the 'good' ending you can do after your first run (here's a hint: just keep walking when you're stopped). 

I had a good time playing this for my pals who are also fans of Korone, but if you're not a fan of Korone there isn't much here. 

My only criticism is that I feel like Korone should have voiced her own lines. Tsuginohi uses voice clips, and I think it would have been cool to have the star of the show say all the creepy stuff that was written for her. Other than that, I was amused playing as my faceless guy walking through a totally normal neighborhood. 

Overall, it's a 7/10. You get what you paid for, there's no bullshit.

102493183.review:
Tsugunohi in general is very hard to recommend. They're walking simulators involving small horror stories, with the theme being that each day gets weirder and creepier (And with more jumpscares). Korone's story is no different even if sold separately.

However, this story mostly involves the inside jokes arround Korone and her streams on a spooky turn, so is further difficult to recommend to someone unfamiliar with either her or Vtubers in general (Granted, Tsugunohi has a Kizuna Ai story). As a big Korone fan like myself you'll have a good experience during both runs (As the second time unlocks a new ending), but someone out of the rabbit hole will simply see a creepy cult story.

So what will it be? Is it worth or not? Personally yes as even without the Vtuber context the story is quite good for what could be between 30 minutes to an hour to see the two endings. On the other hand, being basically a visual novel that costs half the main Tsugunohi which carries more stories (And there's a free version as well) this could be seen as an expensive 1-hour experience for some people. Unless you're a big fan of either Korone and/or Tsugunohi, maybe wait for a sale or just check some streamers (Korone herself played the first ending, while others like Okayu got both).

102483026.review:
[h2]A Quaint Horror Spoof For Hololive Fans. Partial Recommendation: 6/10[/h2]
[hr][/hr]
[i][b]For Linux & Steam Deck: [/b] Gold Experience. Mostly Playable, requires Glorious Eggroll’s custom Proton-6.18-GE-2 or newer.[/i]
[hr][/hr]
Inugami Korone is among the most famous Virtual Youtubers (Vtubers) under the Hololive group. Evil God Korone is a horror-comedy spoof of ImCyan’s original game Tsugunohi. The game is more of an interactive experience rather than game, where you play as a normal teenager who watches virtual streamers. I won’t spoil the rest. The game has good art, in the same family tree as Junji Ito, and the sound design is very good with a lot of drawls and drones that gives it a creepy atmosphere. 

For Hololive fans, they will find much amusement from the story, as it turns Inugami Korone’s natural sadistic charms and cuteness to a yandere level. There are 2 endings and it can be finished under 1 hour so for it’s dirt-cheap price, it’s a “you get what you paid for” type of purchase. 

However, for non-Hololive fan, this game is a tough recommendation, for much of the entertainment derived from the game will go over your head as there is 3 years worth of backstory to Korone’s fandom that you are not privy to. 

If you’re looking for a proper game based on Hololive, the best one is Smol Ame created by KevinCow. However, that game is not available on Steam. if you’re already a Hololive fan or Koronesuki, then Evil God Korone is the next best thing. Partial recommendation.

102436186.review:
ゆびゆびとは、戌神ころねの配信における挨拶であり、視聴者がゆびを差し出すことを意味している。もちろん、実際に指を差し出すことはない。視聴者はPCやスマートフォンを通してYouTubeを開いているだけであり、配信中に視聴をやめてしまったり、ほかの女の配信を見たりしても、捧げた指が帰ってこないなんてことはないのだ。これらは、戌神ころねと視聴者の間におけるコミュニケーションでありジョーク。ちょっと設定が猟奇的で、どこか狂気を孕んでいても、配信者と視聴者の間でよくあるお約束に過ぎないわけだ。なお戌神ころねの配信内には、リスナーをマスコット化したコロネスキーが度々登場しており、コロネスキーにも猟奇的設定が用意されている。ほかの女の配信を見に行く視聴者に厳しい点も、彼女の特徴だろう。

本作「邪神ころね」は、そうした戌神ころねと視聴者のお約束の世界を表現した、ホラーゲームである。ゲームとしての特徴は『つぐのひ』シリーズのほかの作品と同じ。ただ画面内を歩いていくだけなので、誰でもプレイし易い反面、退屈に感じる部分もある。ころさんが、ほかの女の配信を見に行く視聴者にとても厳しい邪神ころねとして出演し、コロネスキーもゲーム内へ多数登場するなど、視聴者にはおなじみ世界観がホラーとして描写されている。総じて、ファン向けのゲームといえよう。そう、本作はゲームなのだ。ころさんの配信を見ずにほかの女の配信を見ていても、本作のようなインシデントが発生したりはしません。ころねさまのはいしんは実際安全で、とてもたのしいです。あ、ころねさまのはいしんがはじまる。ミないと。ゆびゆび。

 give ALL your fingers.

Evil God Korone is about an hour experience running through at max speed. It a game where you move to the left to progress by holding the mouse button. If you played the same developers game TSUGUNOHI its a knock off version created by the man himself. Its a collaboration all for the Inugami Korone Birthday Project. (Happy Birthday Korone!) If you are a fan of Korone you should 100% by the game, its cheap, it nice, funny/cute yet creepy/scary at the same time. It was such a flashbang to find this game on steam at 4:00 AM sleep deprived, and every second of the experience was something I'll very much remember lol. It made me laugh my ass off while also making me feel slightly uneasy.

Its a great little game, all for Korone and her fans, I recommend it to anyone who is a fan of Korone, or maybe even anyone who enjoyed ImCyan's TSUGUNOHI. GIVE ALL OF YOUR FINGERS! Be sure to not just give one.
